prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Phoenix Wright
Description: Me. What more can I say? This is my third year as a young (but skilled!) lawyer.
Character 1
Name: Mia Fey
Description: Maya's older sister and my eternal mentor in life and law. Passed away 2 years ago.
Character 2
Name: Maya Fey
Description: My assistant and a disciple in the Kurain Tradition of spirit channeling.
Character 3
Name: Pearl Fey
Description: Maya's cousin, and channeling prodigy. She has amazingly powerful spiritual abilities.
Character 4
Name: Adrian Andrews
Description: Head of planning, promotion, and security of the Treasures of Kurain Exhibit.
Character 5
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 6
Name: Mask☆DeMasque
Description: A flashy thief who steals valuable works of art. Sends a calling card before a heist.
Character 7
Name: Luke Atmey
Description: An Ace Detective. Has great powers of deduction, yet rarely makes sense.
Character 8
Name: Ron DeLite
Description: A young man who turned himself in as Mask☆DeMasque. A bit of a pitiful guy.
Character 9
Name: Desirée DeLite
Description: Ron DeLite's wife. Seems to be a very friendly and out-going lady.
Character 10
Name: Larry Butz
Description: My friend. I've known this trouble magnet ever since grade school.
Character 11
Name: Godot
Description: A prosecutor who is shrouded in mystery. He seems to know me somehow.
Character 12
Name: Kane Bullard
Description: CEO of KB Security. His body was found inside his safe.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. It shows that I am a defense attorney.
Evidence 1
Name: Maya's Magatama
Description: A present from Maya. It reacts to people who have secrets in their hearts.
Evidence 2
Name: Treasure Exhibit Poster
Description: A poster for the Treasures of Kurain exhibit. The Sacred Urn of Kurain Village will be displayed in Lordly Tailor.
Evidence 3
Name: Ami Fey's Golden Statue
Description: A statue of the founder of the Kurain Channeling Technique. Is holding the Shichishito. A statue of the founder of the Kurain Channeling Technique. Moved the night of the crime. Carried into the basement warehouse the day of the crime. Moved again that night.
Evidence 4
Name: Sacred Urn
Description: One of the treasures of Kurain Village. Supposedly priceless, it looks like a plain old pot. One of the treasures of Kurain Village. Supposedly priceless, but has no monetary value. Found in the office of Luke Atmey. Has pink splotches all over it. Found in Atmey's Office. Covered in pink splotches, but it's the genuine article. Broken and repaired by Adrian 2 weeks ago, then replaced in its box. Kept out of sight.
Evidence 5
Name: DeMasque's Calling Card
Description: Sent before a heist, the emblem is top-secret. Click here for details.
Evidence 6
Name: Shichishito
Description: A ceremonial sword held in the hand of Ami Fey's statue. Wasn't bent before the crime. DeMasque knocked Atmey out during the crime w/ a blow to the back of the head.
Evidence 7
Name: Camera Data
Description: The warehouse camera went off at around 1 AM on the night of the crime.
Evidence 8
Name: Desirée's Letter
Description: Addressed to her husband Ron DeLite. Apparently contains something important.
Evidence 9
Name: Security Camera Photo
Description: Photo of storeroom entrance taken by the camera. Click here for details.
Evidence 10
Name: Blackmail Letter
Description: Written with a fountain pen. Found in Ron's room. Click here to read. Found in Ron DeLite's room. Written by Bullard. Click here to read.
Evidence 11
Name: Ron's Wallet
Description: Found by Larry at his part-time security job's company building (night of the crime).
Evidence 12
Name: Key Card
Description: Found inside Ron's wallet. Apparently used for the building of his part-time job. Found in Ron's wallet. Opens the KB Security CEO's office. Leaves a record when used. Found in Ron's wallet. Used on October 12th, the night of the crime, at 1 AM.
Evidence 13
Name: Publicity Photo
Description: A shot of Mask☆DeMasque striking a pose. Click here for details.
Evidence 14
Name: DeMasque's Broach
Description: Found in the shadow of Ami Fey's statue. Looks like it was torn off of some clothing.
Evidence 15
Name: Kane's Autopsy Report
Description: Time of death: 10/12 at 1 AM. Cause: Cerebral hemorrhaging from blunt trauma to the head.
Evidence 16
Name: Newspaper Clipping
Description: An article on Mask☆DeMasque's first heist. Click here for details. About first heist. Guard in photo is Ron DeLite. Click here for details.
Evidence 17
Name: CEO Office Buzzer
Description: Connected to the basement Security Guard Office. There are no fingerprints on it.
Evidence 18
Name: Kane's List
Description: Found on a table at the crime scene. Click here for details.
Evidence 19
Name: Buzzer Record
Description: The buzzer went off once at 1:02 AM on October 12 in the CEO's office.
Evidence 20
Name: Ron's Testimony
Description: From DeMasque's 2nd heist on, he was stealing as directed by blackmail letters.
Evidence 21
Name: Urn Box
Description: A wooden box that had the Sacred Urn in it. Has pink paint stains on it.
Evidence 22
Name: Paint Marks
Description: Completely dry. The box of the Sacred Urn fits in the gap perfectly. When Adrian dropped the urn's box 2 weeks ago she also knocked over some paint.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: Mask☆DeMasque is a master thief that first started his crime spree 6 months ago.
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 1
Testimony: He's so confident that he sends his calling card before he even commits the crime!
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 2
Testimony: This was his fifth heist, and as usual, he sent a card on to Lordly Tailor.
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 3
Testimony: His pattern is to always go after only the most precious art pieces.
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 4
Testimony: That's why we're sure it was Mask☆DeMasque, sir. It fits his M. O. to a T!
Person: Gumshoe

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
response:
Okay, so I've got this problem where I need to find a contradiction between an evidence and a testimony. Let's break it down step by step. 

First, I'll look at the characters, evidences, and testimonies provided. The main focus is on the crime involving the theft of the Sacred Urn and the murder of Kane Bullard. The suspect is Mask☆DeMasque, a thief known for leaving calling cards.

Looking at the testimonies, all of them are from Dick Gumshoe. He states that Mask☆DeMasque is a master thief who started 6 months ago, sends a calling card before each heist, and this was his fifth heist. He also mentions that DeMasque targets the most precious art pieces, which fits the MO perfectly.

Now, looking at the evidence, I see several items. One key piece is Evidence 5: DeMasque's Calling Card. It says the emblem is top-secret, which implies that it's unique to DeMasque. Another important evidence is Evidence 16: Newspaper Clipping, which talks about DeMasque's first heist and includes a photo where Ron DeLite is a guard. 

Wait, the problem is asking for a contradiction between an evidence and a testimony. So I need to find where something in the evidence contradicts what Gumshoe testified.

Looking closer, the testimonies say it was DeMasque's fifth heist. But the newspaper clipping (Evidence 16) only mentions his first heist. If the first heist is mentioned, and the testimonies say it's the fifth, that would mean there's a discrepancy. However, the testimonies don't specify that the first heist was the only one; they just say it's the fifth, which could include the first.

Another point is the calling card. The evidence says it's top-secret, but if the newspaper clipping shows that Ron DeLite was involved in the first heist, maybe there's a connection. But I'm not sure if that directly contradicts the testimony.

Wait, perhaps the contradiction lies in the number of heists. If the newspaper clipping is about the first heist, and the testimonies say it's the fifth, that might not necessarily contradict unless there's evidence of only one heist. But the testimonies don't provide the exact count, just that it's the fifth.

Hmm, maybe I'm overcomplicating. Let me check again. The testimonies say it's the fifth heist, and the evidence includes a newspaper clipping about the first. That doesn't directly contradict; it just shows that there have been multiple heists. 

Wait, maybe the contradiction is elsewhere. Let me look at other evidences. Evidence 16 is the newspaper clipping about the first heist, and the testimonies say it's the fifth. So if the first heist is mentioned, and the current one is the fifth, that's consistent, not contradictory.

I think I might have made a mistake earlier. Let me try another approach. The testimonies say DeMasque sends a calling card before each heist. The evidence includes the calling card (Evidence 5), which is consistent. So no contradiction there.

Wait, perhaps the contradiction is in the timeline. The newspaper clipping is about the first heist, but the current crime is the fifth. If the first heist was recent, that might conflict with the timeline, but the evidence doesn't specify dates beyond the current crime.

I'm getting a bit stuck. Let me try to find another angle. Maybe the evidence about the Sacred Urn being moved and the Shichishito being bent contradicts something. But the testimonies don't mention those specifics.

Wait, perhaps the contradiction is in the number of heists. The testimonies say it's the fifth, but the evidence only shows the first. That could imply that there's no evidence of four previous heists, which would contradict the testimony. But the problem is that the evidence doesn't mention the number of heists, just the first one.

Alternatively, maybe the contradiction is that the calling card is top-secret (Evidence 5), but the newspaper clipping (Evidence 16) reveals details about the first heist, which might mean the calling card isn't as top-secret as claimed. But that's a stretch.

I think I need to look for a more direct contradiction. Let me check the testimonies again. Gumshoe says it's DeMasque's fifth heist, fitting his MO. The evidence includes a calling card, which fits, but the newspaper clipping only mentions the first heist. So the contradiction is that the evidence only shows the first heist, not five, which contradicts the testimony that it's the fifth.

Wait, but the problem is to find one pair. So maybe the answer is that the testimony about it being the fifth heist contradicts the evidence which only shows the first heist.

So, the evidence is 16 (newspaper clipping about first heist) and testimony is 4 (saying it's the fifth heist). That would be the contradiction.
</think>

{"evidence": 16, "testimony": 4}

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
response:
Okay, I'm trying to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. Let me go through the provided information step by step.

First, I'll look at the characters, but since the question is about evidence and testimonies, I can focus on those. The evidence and testimonies are numbered, so I need to compare each evidence with each testimony to find a contradiction.

Looking at the testimonies, they're all from Luke Atmey. Let's go through them one by one.

Testimony 0: Atmey says the incident happened around 1 AM, just after the date changed. So the time is around 1 AM.

Testimony 1: He mentions that Mask☆DeMasque descended upon him, implying the thief was present.

Testimony 2: Atmey says he was struck from behind, leading to his unconsciousness.

Testimony 3: He awoke after being knocked out and found the thief gone.

Testimony 4: He called the police 30 minutes later, which would be around 1:30 AM.

Now, looking at the evidence:

Evidence 7: Camera Data shows the warehouse camera went off at around 1 AM on the night of the crime. This aligns with Atmey's testimony about the time.

Evidence 19: Buzzer Record indicates the CEO Office Buzzer went off at 1:02 AM. This is shortly after 1 AM, which is consistent with the timeline Atmey described.

But wait, Atmey's testimony 4 says he called the police 30 minutes after the incident. If the incident was at 1 AM, then the call would be at 1:30 AM. However, the Buzzer Record (Evidence 19) shows the buzzer went off at 1:02 AM, which is just 2 minutes after the incident. This suggests that the buzzer was triggered almost immediately after the crime, not 30 minutes later as Atmey claims.

So, there's a contradiction here. Atmey's testimony about waiting 30 minutes to call the police contradicts the evidence showing the buzzer was activated just 2 minutes after the crime. This implies that the timeline of events doesn't match up.

Another point: Evidence 15, Kane's Autopsy Report, states the time of death was 10/12 at 1 AM. This aligns with Atmey's testimony about the time, so no contradiction there.

Looking at other evidence, like the camera data (Evidence 7) and the buzzer record (Evidence 19), they both point to the crime happening around 1 AM, but the timing of the buzzer activation conflicts with Atmey's claim of waiting 30 minutes to call the police.

Therefore, the contradiction is between Evidence 19 (Buzzer Record at 1:02 AM) and Testimony 4 (Atmey claiming he called the police 30 minutes later, which would be 1:30 AM, but the buzzer was already activated at 1:02 AM, indicating the police were notified much sooner).
</think>

{"evidence": 19, "testimony": 4}

response:
Okay, so I'm trying to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. Let's break down the problem step by step.

First, I'll look at the evidence and testimonies provided. The goal is to find a pair where one piece of evidence directly contradicts a testimony given by a witness.

Looking at the evidence list, there's Evidence 6, which describes the Shichishito. It mentions that the sword wasn't bent before the crime but was used by DeMasque to knock Atmey out during the crime by striking him on the back of the head. This suggests that the sword was used as a weapon in the crime.

Now, examining the testimonies, Testimony 4 by Atmey states that the thief grabbed a weapon from the side and rendered him senseless. Atmey also mentions that the thief's first blow struck true, rendering him unconscious. This implies that the thief used a weapon to attack Atmey.

However, Evidence 6 specifically says that the Shichishito was used to knock Atmey out. If the sword was used, then the testimony aligns with the evidence. But wait, let me double-check. The evidence says the sword wasn't bent before the crime, but it was used to knock Atmey out. The testimony says the thief grabbed a weapon and struck Atmey. So, in this case, the evidence and testimony seem to agree that a weapon (the sword) was used.

Wait, maybe I'm missing something. Let me look again. Oh, I see. The evidence says the sword wasn't bent before the crime, implying it was in its original state. But the testimony doesn't mention the sword specifically; it just mentions a weapon. So, perhaps there's no direct contradiction here.

Wait, maybe I should look elsewhere. Let's check other evidence. Evidence 19 is the Buzzer Record, which states that the buzzer went off once at 1:02 AM on October 12 in the CEO's office. Now, looking at the testimonies, Testimony 4 says that the thief struck Atmey and rendered him senseless. If the buzzer was activated at 1:02 AM, that might indicate someone entering or exiting the office. But Atmey's testimony doesn't mention the buzzer or the time of the strike. So, perhaps there's no direct contradiction here either.

Hmm, maybe I need to look at another pair. Let's consider Evidence 15, the Autopsy Report, which states that Kane Bullard died at 10/12 at 1 AM from cerebral hemorrhaging due to blunt trauma. Now, looking at the testimonies, Testimony 0 mentions that Atmey was attacked around 1 AM. If Atmey was attacked at 1 AM, and Bullard died at 1 AM, perhaps there's a connection. But does that create a contradiction? Not necessarily, unless the timing implies something else.

Wait, perhaps I'm overcomplicating this. Let me go back to the initial pair I considered. Evidence 6 and Testimony 4 both involve the use of a weapon. The evidence specifies the sword, while the testimony refers to a weapon in general. So, they don't contradict each other; instead, they support each other.

Maybe I need to find another pair where the evidence and testimony contradict. Let's look at Evidence 19 again. It says the buzzer went off at 1:02 AM. Now, if Atmey's testimony says he was attacked at 1 AM, and the buzzer went off two minutes later, that could imply that someone else entered the office after the attack. But that doesn't necessarily contradict; it just provides additional information.

Wait, perhaps the contradiction lies elsewhere. Let me check the evidence and testimonies again. Evidence 6 says the sword was used to knock Atmey out, but Testimony 4 says the thief grabbed a weapon and struck Atmey. If the sword was used, then the testimony aligns. But if the evidence says the sword wasn't bent, implying it was used as a weapon, and the testimony says a weapon was used, that's consistent.

I'm starting to think that maybe there's no direct contradiction between any evidence and testimony in this case. However, the user is asking for one pair, so perhaps I'm missing something.

Wait, let me consider another angle. Evidence 16 is the Newspaper Clipping, which mentions Ron DeLite as a guard in the first heist. If Ron was involved in the first heist, but Testimony 4 says the thief used a weapon to knock Atmey out, perhaps there's a contradiction if Ron's involvement implies he wasn't the thief.
